Revit Projects

Some samples of My Revit Projects

Los Angles County Museum of Art

Los Angles, CA USA
Architect Peter Zumthor and SOM Structural Engineers

The Los Angles County Museum of Art (LACMA) is a project with architect Peter Zumthor. The building will be roughly 350,000 square feet. Designed to resemble the La Brea Tar Pits in Los Angles.

The complexity, tighter tolerance level, and magnitude of this Revit project have pushed me to create scripts and add-ins to generate this model. This project is a complete rethink of what Revit is capable of doing.

Jinan Subway Station Skylight

Shandong, China
SOM Architecture & Structural Engineers

Jinan subway station skylight is designed as a lotus flower. The flower is representative of the location.

The Revit model is geometry generated and sized using the Etabs model. The Revit model has never had any modeling except for the creation of sheets and details.

Moscone Convention Center Expansion

San Francisco, California US
SOM Architecture & Structural Engineers

The convention center project added more than 305,000 square feet of area. The project is an iconic building on Howard Street which added vertical levels and a bridge connecting the two sides.

The work I put into this project and its complexity have allowed it to be featured on the cover Mastering Revit 2020. Iâ€™m proud of the BIM model and happy it has gained recognition in the Revit world.

Janet Echelman Austin Airport

Austin, Texas US
Artist Janet Echelman and SOM Structural Engineers

Janet Echelman is an American sculptor and artist. She creates aerial fiber rope sculptures that are large and complex.

The Austin Airport project in Revit is using a Rhino model which is designed by the Structural Engineer. We use a CSV file to import line geometry, point geometry, and metadata. The color is also added to map member sizes to create and update the geometry in Revit.

Torre Reforma

Mexico City, Mexico
Architect Sordo Madaleno and SOM Structural Engineers

This is a new development in the heart of Mexico City with Sordo Madaleno architects. The Revit project has an 8 level garage and 7 story podium with a bridge. The project also includes 3 towers the largest is a 60 story tower and the other two are 44 story towers. This is all completely done in Revit.

Superior Court House San Diego

San Diego, California, US
SOM Architecture & Structural Engineers

The San Diego Court House is a 25 story downtown tower. The project has a podium and a tower.

One of the first projects completely done in Revit at Skidmore Owing and Merrill by both architecture and engineering.
